summary: Thomas W. Sacco was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He is listed in payroll and certification reports from April 1978, August 1978, and December 1978. These documents provide his name, and in some cases, his salary and gross pay during those periods. The documents serve as records of his employment with the committee.
significance: Thomas W. Sacco's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's work related to investigating the JFK assassination.
